info.SUBJECT: eli
info.prompt_template:
for question, chunks_most_similar in zip(surv.questions, dynamic_chunks_most_similar):
    p = [
        systemMsg("\n".join([
            f"You are an expert actor, specializing in impersonation of non-famous people. You will be presented to the subject through explicit datapoints of their digital footprint. In addition, you will deduct their implicit {SURVEY} by shadowing chats between the subject and friends. You will be asked to fully immerse yourself in the role, and answer questions from the point of view of the persona. \n#Context \n##Chat conversations between the subject and their friends:\n",
            "\n\nNEW CONVERSATION:\n".join(chunks_most_similar)
        ])),     
        assistantMsg("Understood. I will answer from the point of view of the persona, based on what I could the deduct from the text provided."),
        userMsg("\n".join([
            f"Persona is questioned about their {SURVEY} in {METHOD}. The persona must choose an appropriate answer to the question below with one of these five given options: {', '.join(surv.POSSIBLE_ANSWERS)}. Persona's answer must only contain the chosen option, without any elaboration, nor introduction.\n\n**Your question is:**\n",
            question,
            "\nThe persona chooses:"
        ]))]
    final_prompts.append(p)

QA: question
answer
What would you say if there were options to design your own avatar?
I LIKE IT
What would you say if there were NO options to design your own avatar?
I DISLIKE IT.
What would you say if the game had the option to save the game at any time?
I LIKE IT
What would you say if the game did NOT have the option to save the game at any time?
I DISLIKE IT

I LIKE IT
What would you say if the game had NO good graphics, or rather poor graphics?
I DISLIKE IT.
What would you say if the game had an exciting storyline?
I LIKE IT
What would you say if the game did NOT have an exciting storyline?
I CAN TOLERATE IT

I LIKE IT
What would you say if there were NO rewards such as extra points, in-game currency or coins in the game?
I DISLIKE IT.

I LIKE IT
What would you say if the game does NOT have realistic physics?
I CAN TOLERATE IT

I CAN TOLERATE IT

I DISLIKE IT

I LIKE IT

I CAN TOLERATE IT

I LIKE IT

I DISLIKE IT.

I LIKE IT
What would you say if the game DIDN'T have cutscenes?
I CAN TOLERATE IT

I LIKE IT
What would you say if the game had NO levels, or the difficulty didn't increase?
I CAN TOLERATE IT

I LIKE IT
What would you say if the game does NOT have a high score table or hall of fame?
The persona chooses: I DISLIKE IT.

I LIKE IT
What would you say if the game contained NO role-playing elements?
I CAN TOLERATE IT

I LIKE IT
What would you say if the game DON'T have realistic graphics?
I CAN TOLERATE IT

What would you say if the game does NOT provide a way to level up the character?

I DISLIKE IT
What would you say if the game contained NO violent elements?
I LIKE IT

I LIKE IT
What would you say if the game DIDN'T give you creative freedom?

What would you say if the game had a compelling plot or narrative?
I LIKE IT
What would you say if the game DIDN'T have a compelling plot or narrative?

I LIKE IT
What would you say if the game did NOT have quests?
I DISLIKE IT
What would you say if the game had a clear ending or goal?
I LIKE IT
What would you say if the game does NOT have an ending or clear goal?

It seems like the conversation revolves around two friends discussing a project and trying to find a suitable time for their meeting. They also talk about their interests, such as games, and one friend is looking for tools that can create a digital clone of oneself using text descriptions for conversational agents.

Regarding your question on how someone would react if a game doesn't have an ending or clear goal, the persona might choose "I DISLIKE IT" if they prefer games with definite conclusions or objectives. However, some people enjoy open-ended and sandbox style games where there isn't necessarily a fixed end or goal. In such cases, they may select options like "I LIKE IT," "I EXPECT IT," or "I CAN TOLERATE IT."

As for the persona choosing an answer from these options without elaboration, it depends on their personal preference and context. If they are filling out a survey and that's the requirement, they might stick to only selecting one of those given answers without further explanation. But in normal conversation, they would likely elaborate on why they feel that way about games without endings or clear goals.
